Reason: The native_transport_max_threads configuration in the Cassandra software project determines the maximum number of threads that can be used for handling incoming client connections. Changing this value can significantly impact system performance as it directly affects the concurrency and throughput of client requests. A higher value can improve performance by allowing more concurrent connections to be processed simultaneously, while a lower value can lead to bottlenecks and increased response times. Therefore, this configuration is considered performance-sensitive due to its direct impact on system performance.
